Guard.synopsis: Gard at Highberry's house, after the crimes. Is guarding the main door.

Guard_Interior.synopsis: Gard at Highberry's house, after the crimes. Is guarding the main door.

OnlyRoger.synopsis: Dialogue between the players and Roger Highberry in the Serial Killer situation. This dialog will be used while de Wine Festival and if Cora dies.
OnlyRoger.how_to_trigger: When making click on Roger Highberry and Cora is dead (by the hand of the player or in the battle with Dolor).Coordinates: larian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1744.392090;41.463974;639.926086&camTarget=-1745.265991;41.178829;639.532410Relevant flags in this page: https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GUS/pages/2624159852/Lower+City+Debug+Commands

Dolor.synopsis: Dialogue with Dolor at the wine festival. Need to keep this structore more or less to avoid have a cinematic too mucho complex.
Dolor.how_to_trigger: Trigger wine festival:oe LOW_SKbeginClick on Dolor at the wine festival, involves Cora and, as optional speaker, Roger Highberry.Coordinates: S_LOW_Dolor_55837c0f-0171-4020-a4a3-dd6de7ffc134

OnlyCora.synopsis: Dialogue between the players and Cora Highberry in the Serial Killer situation. Appears when Roger is dead (before or after Dolor appears). There are the first victims. A flag mark the dialogue happens before Dolor appears and other flag if Dolor is killed.
OnlyCora.how_to_trigger: When making click on Cora Highberry and Roger is dead (by the hand of the player or in the battle with Dolor).Coordinates: larian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1744.392090;41.463974;639.926086&camTarget=-1745.265991;41.178829;639.532410Relevant flags in this page: https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GUS/pages/2624159852/Lower+City+Debug+Commands

WithoutMurderer.synopsis: Dialogue between the players and the Highberrys (both, alive) in the Serial Killer situation. There are the first victims. A flag signal the dialogue happens before Dolor appears and other flag if Dolor is killed and the couple survives.
WithoutMurderer.how_to_trigger: Click on one of the Highberrys after and before Dolor appears. Not while he is there.Coordinates: S_LOW_CoraHighberry_8a520cf7-c5da-419f-bdd4-792b27c5c679Relevant flags in this page: https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GUS/pages/2624159852/Lower+City+Debug+Commands

Cora_SwD.synopsis: If Dolor kills Cora with the ritual, not in the wine festival, we will have a SwD dialog with Cora to get some clues about her killer.
Cora_SwD.how_to_trigger: Start the quest, be at the wine festival and take a long rest. The following day, we will have a crime scene.Character: S_LOW_CoraHighberry_8a520cf7-c5da-419f-bdd4-792b27c5c679

Guard_1.speaker: Fist Rusk
Guard_1.text: 'Scuse me, civilian, I'd advise you steer clear. We've got a crime scene here, and not enough folk to make sure it's safe.

Guard_6.speaker: Fist Rusk
Guard_6.text: Cora Highberry was murdered at the wine festival. Damn shame - her and her husband were a delightful couple.

Guard_10.speaker: Fist Rusk
Guard_10.text: On your own head be it, civilian. A fresh set of eyes can't hurt.

Guard_2.speaker: Fist Rusk
Guard_2.text: I'm sorry, civilian, but I really don't have time to waste. We're down a constable, and the killer could strike again at any time.

Guard_5.speaker: Player
Guard_5.text: Can you remind me what happened here?

Guard_3.speaker: Fist Rusk
Guard_3.text: This is an active crime scene, civilian. The constable has advised the public steer well clear.

Guard_8.speaker: Fist Rusk
Guard_8.text: Get a move on, civilian. We've no time to waste here.

Guard_Interior_0.speaker: Fist Aguta
Guard_Interior_0.text: Oi, civvie, clear off. We've got a crime scene to secure and one less constable to help do it - gods rest her soul.

Guard_Interior_1.speaker: Fist Aguta
Guard_Interior_1.text: Keep interrupting me and I'll write you up for interfering in Fist business.

Guard_Interior_2.speaker: Fist Aguta
Guard_Interior_2.text: 'Scuse me, guv - this is a crime scene. If you've business here, go talk with Constable Devella.

Guard_Interior_3.speaker: Fist Aguta
Guard_Interior_3.text: 'Fraid I've no time to help you, I've got too many bodies to check.

OnlyRoger_0.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_0.text: How could someone... do such a thing?
OnlyRoger_0.context: NodeContext: his wife has just died

OnlyRoger_1.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_1.text: Please, leave me to my memories, if you wouldn't mind.

OnlyRoger_2.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_2.text: Cora would've loved this. Everyone so cheery, the charmed weather... Gods...
OnlyRoger_2.context: NodeContext: Roger speaks in wistful, sad tones about Cora

OnlyRoger_3.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_3.context: NodeContext: his wife has just died

OnlyRoger_4.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_4.text: Th - thank you for saving me from that terrible man.

OnlyRoger_5.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_5.text: I just wish Cora could've been saved too...

OnlyRoger_6.speaker: Roger Highberry
OnlyRoger_6.text: Please, leave me to my memories, if you wouldn't mind.

Dolor_4.speaker: Cora Highberry
Dolor_4.text: Oh, how lovely, our visitors return! We were just about to try some of Master Meztli's delightful wines. Would you care to join us?

Dolor_5.speaker: Roger Highberry
Dolor_5.text: They do look ever so tasty.

Dolor_7.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_7.text: Ah, Mrs Highberry, I prefer to conduct tastings individually, so I may assess your palate -

Dolor_15.speaker: Cora Highberry
Dolor_15.text: Call me Cora, Master Meztli. And I'm afraid I must insist on their joining us - wine's no good without company, after all!

Dolor_30.speaker: Narrator
Dolor_30.text: *The wine's scent is almost sickly sweet, with an acrid note just on the periphery. Poison.*

Dolor_6.speaker: Player
Dolor_6.text: That wine is poisonous, Cora. This man is trying to kill you.

Dolor_9.speaker: Player
Dolor_9.text: This fiend has sullied good wine with poison!

Dolor_32.speaker: Player
Dolor_32.text: Oh, poisoned wine? Now, that's a classic.

Dolor_25.speaker: Player
Dolor_25.text: Get back! This cowardly worm is trying to poison you!

Dolor_17.speaker: Player
Dolor_17.text: I've smelled many a wine in my time, and this one's foul. Poisonous.

Dolor_18.speaker: Player
Dolor_18.text: Cora Highberry, your life is in danger. A serial killer is after you.

Dolor_3.speaker: Roger Highberry
Dolor_3.text: I must say, if this is a practical joke, it is not very amusing.

Dolor_37.speaker: Cora Highberry
Dolor_37.text: Why, a serial killer? That's terrib- Master Meztli? Are you quite all right?

Dolor_2.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_2.text: It was perfect... perfectperfectperfect... You have sullied it with knowledge. Made it an unclean sacrifice. I will remember your face.
Dolor_2.context: NodeContext: this is a serial killer who's just been unmasked, madcap, angry, incensed

Dolor_0.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_0.text: And I will peel it from your skull should you interfere again.
Dolor_0.context: NodeContext: this is a serial killer who's just been unmasked, madcap, angry, incensed

Dolor_24.speaker: Player
Dolor_24.text: I would love a glass, Master Meztli.

Dolor_31.speaker: Cora Highberry
Dolor_31.text: See, Master Meztli, surely you can't turn away a prospective customer.

Dolor_10.speaker: Roger Highberry
Dolor_10.text: I was in business for a great many years, Master Meztli, and my wife, as always, is most correct.

Dolor_26.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_26.text: Very... well. Here - now leave me to attend my customers, please.
Dolor_26.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Pouring of wine should happen after cinematic dialogue closes, either implied through behaviour in gameplay, or NPCs go straight to drinking wine

[removed this] - Meztli pours the wine into glasses

Adam

Dolor_11.speaker: Player
Dolor_11.text: I'm afraid I must decline, but I hope you enjoy your wine.

Dolor_23.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_23.text: Then please, Mrs Highberry, lead the toast.
Dolor_23.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Pouring of wine should happen after cinematic dialogue closes, either implied through behaviour in gameplay, or NPCs go straight to drinking wine

[removed this] - Meztli pours the wine into glasses

Adam

Dolor_42.speaker: Player
Dolor_42.text: I think it's only polite that we let Master Meztli drink first, or should I say... Dolor?

Dolor_19.speaker: Cora Highberry
Dolor_19.text: Why, hello there! We were just about to try some of Master Meztli's delightful wines. Would you care to join us?

OnlyCora_1.speaker: Cora Highberry
OnlyCora_1.text: Please, enjoy yourselves. Make the most of the festivities, you never know when it'll be your last chance...
OnlyCora_1.context: NodeContext: Cora says this is in a sad, wistful tone

OnlyCora_2.speaker: Cora Highberry
OnlyCora_2.text: Please, leave me be. I'm not in the mood for idle chatter.

OnlyCora_4.speaker: Cora Highberry
OnlyCora_4.text: If only my Roger was here to see this... He did love his festivals...
OnlyCora_4.context: NodeContext: Cora says this is in a sad, wistful tone

OnlyCora_5.speaker: Player
OnlyCora_5.text: I'm sorry, Mrs Highberry. You're on a list of murder targets, you aren't safe.

OnlyCora_3.speaker: Cora Highberry
OnlyCora_3.text: Listen, my dear, I'm sure you thought this 'you're in danger' jape amusing, but it's rather horrid.

WithoutMurderer_17.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_17.text: I think Master Meztli was keen for us to try his wine. Speak with him if you wish to join us.

WithoutMurderer_21.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_21.text: Why, whatever was the matter with that man? Why did he take off so quickly?
WithoutMurderer_21.context: InternalNodeContext: This node will only enter the first time we try to speak with the highberrys after saving cora in perfect stealth

WithoutMurderer_12.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_12.text: You're on a list of murder targets. Cora. I was protecting you.

WithoutMurderer_3.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_3.text: I don't know why he ran. Coward.

WithoutMurderer_19.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_19.text: Perhaps he left the stove on.

WithoutMurderer_32.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_32.text: Yes, I suppose so... Doesn't explain all the shouting though.

WithoutMurderer_33.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_33.text: I am so glad that monster was stopped.

WithoutMurderer_10.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_10.text: Me too, my love. Me too.

WithoutMurderer_2.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_2.text: Ah, so I see. Are we expecting anyone, Cora?

WithoutMurderer_50.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_50.text: No - the grocer's just been, as has the chandler. Then there's your tailor - he's due soon to get the children outfitted for the festival...

WithoutMurderer_42.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_42.text: And of course, the Wine Festival itself is but a few days away - Cora, we do forget ourselves! We've not even asked this fine young stranger's name.

WithoutMurderer_5.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_5.text: I am Cora Highberry, and this is my husband, Roger. Delighted to meet you.

WithoutMurderer_14.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_14.text: More than delighted! A little extra company's always welcome as we enter our twilight years - yet another reason we're putting on the wine festival!

WithoutMurderer_30.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_30.text: Soon you are to be sacrificed, little lambs. You are on Father Bhaal's naughty list.

WithoutMurderer_13.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_13.text: I must say, if this a practical joke, it's of distinctly poor taste.

WithoutMurderer_8.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_8.text: I don't know, Roger... We were just talking about the city being unsafe - and what of the children? If there's even the slightest chance -

WithoutMurderer_16.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_16.text: Cora, my dear, who would really take the time our of their day to harm us?

WithoutMurderer_20.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_20.text: Besides - if they try, well, I've got some life in me yet.

WithoutMurderer_47.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_47.text: I'm sorry, Mrs Highberry, but you're on a list of murder targets. You're not safe here.

WithoutMurderer_4.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_4.text: I bet that'll draw quite the crowd in a city like this.

WithoutMurderer_48.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_48.text: We hope so, it's going to be right on our doorstep!

WithoutMurderer_18.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_18.text: The festival was put together to raise funds for the children, you see. Times are a touch tough at the moment.

WithoutMurderer_25.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_25.text: Which children are you raising money for?

WithoutMurderer_37.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_37.text: Young Molly and Timothy, who we've recently taken charge of. Their parents... Well. War leaves the nastiest scars.

WithoutMurderer_40.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_40.text: It's very kind of you to take orphans into your home.

WithoutMurderer_34.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_34.text: We're lucky to be blessed with a rather spacious one - seems cruel to let it go unused if there are children in need.

WithoutMurderer_28.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_28.text: Perhaps a small donation would help salve those scars? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

WithoutMurderer_1.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_1.text: Oh, but we couldn't accept your money for nothing -

WithoutMurderer_9.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_9.text: Nothing, Cora? All the work you put in with the little ones is hardly nothing. Thank you, any help we can get is a blessing.

WithoutMurderer_26.speaker: Roger Highberry
WithoutMurderer_26.text: You're welcome to stay a while if you like. Does us good to have a little extra life in the house.

WithoutMurderer_44.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_44.text: But do be careful if you're out and about - city's just not as safe as it used to be.

WithoutMurderer_7.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_7.text: If times are tough, I'm happy to donate. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

WithoutMurderer_38.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_38.text: I'll let you get on with your day.

WithoutMurderer_52.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_52.text: 'Another' reason? Why else would you run a wine festival?

WithoutMurderer_41.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_41.text: Lovely to meet you, but I really must be going.

WithoutMurderer_29.speaker: Player
WithoutMurderer_29.text: Just a stranger - and a lost one at that. I'll show my way out.

WithoutMurderer_45.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_45.text: It is so lovely to see more young folk around the place. Really is.

WithoutMurderer_49.speaker: Cora Highberry
WithoutMurderer_49.text: I still can't believe... why would anyone want to kill... me? Th-thank you for saving us...

Cora_SwD_23.speaker: Narrator
Cora_SwD_23.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Cora_SwD_4.speaker: Narrator
Cora_SwD_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Cora_SwD_1.speaker: Player
Cora_SwD_1.text: Do you know where your killer was heading next?

Cora_SwD_2.speaker: Player
Cora_SwD_2.text: What were you doing when you were killed?

Cora_SwD_12.speaker: Cora Highberry
Cora_SwD_12.text: Tasting wine... with Roger... Master Meztli...

Cora_SwD_14.speaker: Player
Cora_SwD_14.text: Why did you have the orphanage?

Cora_SwD_19.speaker: Cora Highberry
Cora_SwD_19.text: War on... Children... Need a home...

Cora_SwD_26.speaker: Narrator
Cora_SwD_26.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Cora_SwD_28.speaker: Narrator
Cora_SwD_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*
